description: In the relational model of databases, a primary key is a specific choice of a minimal set of attributes (columns) that uniquely specify a tuple (row) in a relation (table). Informally, a primary key is "which attributes identify a record", and in simple cases are simply a single attribute: a unique id. More formally, a primary key is a choice of candidate key ; any other candidate key is an alternate key.
name: Primary Keys
